title: Dwarvish short sword
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Dwarvish_short_sword/zh-CN "Dwarvish short sword/zh-CN")

| ) [![Dwarvish short sword.png](/images/a/a4/Dwarvish_short_sword.png)](/wiki/File:Dwarvish_short_sword.png) |                                                         |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                                                        | dwarvish short sword                                    |
| Appearance                                                                                                  | broad short sword                                       |
| Damage vs. small                                                                                            | 1d7                                                     |
| Damage vs. large                                                                                            | 1d8                                                     |
| To-hit bonus                                                                                                | +0                                                      |
| Weapon skill                                                                                                | [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword")          |
| Size                                                                                                        | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")             |
| Base price                                                                                                  | 10 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                                                                      | [30](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                             |
| Material                                                                                                    | [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron")                               |

A **dwarvish short sword** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") and uses the [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword") skill, and appears as a **broad short sword** when unidentified.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.4 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Player [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") start the game with knowledge of the dwarvish short sword.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Any dwarven character that would start the game with a short sword will start with a dwarvish short sword instead - currently, there are no applicable roles where this substitution would occur.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Dwarvish short swords make up about 0.2% of randomly generated weapons. In addition to random generation, weapon [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and general stores can stock dwarvish short swords.

Live [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster_attribute\) "Dwarf (monster attribute)") have a 1⁄4 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a dwarvish short sword.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) [Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), including those on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have a chance lower than 1% of generating with a dwarvish short sword as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Strategy

The dwarvish short sword is a good early-game weapon for roles capable of training the skill, and can even serve as a decent off-hand weapon when [twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon").

## History

The dwarvish short sword first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a dwarvish short sword will produce either an [elven short sword](/wiki/Elven_short_sword "Elven short sword") or a [dark elven short sword](/wiki/Dark_elven_short_sword_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven short sword (SLASH'EM)") with an equal probability of each. Upgrading a short sword, elven short sword or dark elven short sword will produce a dwarvish short sword.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), a dwarvish short sword deals d8 damage to small monsters and d7 damage to large monsters, and its weight is increased to 35 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), a dwarvish short sword can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a short sword and a [dwarvish spear](/wiki/Dwarvish_spear "Dwarvish spear"). Dwarvish short swords can be used at a forge to make a few items:

- A dwarvish short sword can be combined with an [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe") to create a [dwarvish bearded axe](/wiki/Dwarvish_bearded_axe "Dwarvish bearded axe").
- A dwarvish short sword can be combined with a [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") to create a [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock").
- A dwarvish short sword can be combined with a [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet") to create a [dwarvish helm](/wiki/Dwarvish_helm "Dwarvish helm").
- A dwarvish short sword can be combined with a pair of [gauntlets](/wiki/Gauntlets_\(EvilHack\) "Gauntlets (EvilHack)") to create a pair of [dwarvish boots](/wiki/Dwarvish_boots "Dwarvish boots").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), upgrading a dwarvish short sword will produce an [orcish short sword](/wiki/Orcish_short_sword "Orcish short sword"), and upgrading an elven short sword will produce a dwarvish short sword. Forging recipes are the same as in EvilHack.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 838](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L838)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 225](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L225): *Race-based substitutions for initial inventory*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 373](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L373)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 155](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L155): *1⁄2 to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Dwarvish short sword

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
)
Name dwarvish short sword
Appearance broad short sword
Damage vs. small 1d7
Damage vs. large 1d8
To-hit bonus +0
Weapon skill short sword
Size one-handed
Base price 10 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 30
Material iron

A dwarvish short sword is a type of weapon that appears in NetHack. It is made of iron and uses the short sword skill, and appears as a broad short sword when unidentified.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 dNetHack
    • 4.3 EvilHack
    • 4.4 Hack'EM
  • 5 References

Generation

Player dwarves start the game with knowledge of the dwarvish short sword.[1] Any dwarven character that would start the game with a short sword will start with a dwarvish short sword instead - currently, there are no applicable roles where this substitution would occur.[2]

Dwarvish short swords make up about 0.2% of randomly generated weapons. In addition to random generation, weapon shops and general stores can stock dwarvish short swords.

Live dwarves have a 1⁄4 chance of being generated with a dwarvish short sword.[3] Player monsters, including those on the Astral Plane, have a chance lower than 1% of generating with a dwarvish short sword as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.[4]

Strategy

The dwarvish short sword is a good early-game weapon for roles capable of training the skill, and can even serve as a decent off-hand weapon when twoweaponing.

History

The dwarvish short sword first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, upgrading a dwarvish short sword will produce either an elven short sword or a dark elven short sword with an equal probability of each. Upgrading a short sword, elven short sword or dark elven short sword will produce a dwarvish short sword.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, a dwarvish short sword deals d8 damage to small monsters and d7 damage to large monsters, and its weight is increased to 35 aum.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, a dwarvish short sword can be created at a forge by combining a short sword and a dwarvish spear. Dwarvish short swords can be used at a forge to make a few items:

  • A dwarvish short sword can be combined with an axe to create a dwarvish bearded axe.
  • A dwarvish short sword can be combined with a pick-axe to create a dwarvish mattock.
  • A dwarvish short sword can be combined with a helmet to create a dwarvish helm.
  • A dwarvish short sword can be combined with a pair of gauntlets to create a pair of dwarvish boots.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, upgrading a dwarvish short sword will produce an orcish short sword, and upgrading an elven short sword will produce a dwarvish short sword. Forging recipes are the same as in EvilHack.

References

  1. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 838
  2. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 225: Race-based substitutions for initial inventory
  3. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 373
  4. ↑ src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 155: 1⁄2 to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds

A '''dwarvish short sword''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is made of [[iron]] and uses the [[short sword]] skill, and appears as a '''broad short sword''' when unidentified.

==Generation==
Player [[Dwarf (starting race)|dwarves]] start the game with knowledge of the dwarvish short sword.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|838|nethack=3.6.7}} Any dwarven character that would start the game with a short sword will start with a dwarvish short sword instead - currently, there are no applicable roles where this substitution would occur.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|225|nethack=3.6.7|comment=Race-based substitutions for initial inventory}}

Dwarvish short swords make up about 0.2% of randomly generated weapons. In addition to random generation, weapon [[shop]]s and general stores can stock dwarvish short swords.

Live [[Dwarf (monster attribute)|dwarves]] have a {{frac|4}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] a dwarvish short sword.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|373|nethack=3.6.7}} [[Player monster]]s, including those on the [[Astral Plane]], have a chance lower than 1% of generating with a dwarvish short sword as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|155|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment={{frac|2}} to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds}}

==Strategy==
The dwarvish short sword is a good early-game weapon for roles capable of training the skill, and can even serve as a decent off-hand weapon when [[twoweapon]]ing.

==History==
The dwarvish short sword first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], [[upgrading]] a dwarvish short sword will produce either an [[elven short sword]] or a [[Dark elven short sword (SLASH'EM)|dark elven short sword]] with an equal probability of each. Upgrading a short sword, elven short sword or dark elven short sword will produce a dwarvish short sword.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], a dwarvish short sword deals d8 damage to small monsters and d7 damage to large monsters, and its weight is increased to 35 [[aum]].

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], a dwarvish short sword can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining a short sword and a [[dwarvish spear]]. Dwarvish short swords can be used at a forge to make a few items:

* A dwarvish short sword can be combined with an [[axe]] to create a [[dwarvish bearded axe]].
* A dwarvish short sword can be combined with a [[pick-axe]] to create a [[dwarvish mattock]].
* A dwarvish short sword can be combined with a [[helmet]] to create a [[dwarvish helm]].
* A dwarvish short sword can be combined with a pair of [[Gauntlets (EvilHack)|gauntlets]] to create a pair of [[dwarvish boots]].

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], upgrading a dwarvish short sword will produce an [[orcish short sword]], and upgrading an elven short sword will produce a dwarvish short sword. Forging recipes are the same as in EvilHack.
